title: How to Dry Jeans Quickly with an Iron

steps.title: Wring out any extra water.
steps.content: Wring out any extra water. This method only works if the jeans aren't soaking wet. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Take a towel, fold it so that it will fit into the leg of your jeans and place it in the leg.
steps.content: Take a towel, fold it so that it will fit into the leg of your jeans and place it in the leg.

steps.title: Turn your iron on the highest heat setting suitable for the jeans.
steps.content: Turn your iron on the highest heat setting suitable for the jeans. Start to iron. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Hold and move the iron around a lot.
steps.content: Hold and move the iron around a lot. Keep pressing until your jeans brighten up to their normal color. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Repeat on the other leg.
steps.content: Repeat on the other leg. Continue until the jeans are dry enough to wear; any residual dampness will dry off during wearing, provided it's a warm enough day.
